intro: Castelaria macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf castelaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that often display vibrant colors. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring broad, lance-shaped leaves that can reach significant sizes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural practices.
